revised_title: An Account of a Child Born Alive without a Brain and the Observables in It on Dissection
tldr: The author describes the case of a child born without a brain and examines its anatomy, including the absence of the cranium, cerebrum, and cerebellum. The child's eyes and ears resembled those of a monkey, and the absence of the brain was replaced by a congealed blood-like substance covered by a membrane. The author discusses the circulation of blood and the role of the medulla spinalis in the life of animals.
